Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: First, looking at the system log entries, each line has a timestamp, an action type like FOCUS, TYPING, SWITCH, and some context like the application and window title. The window titles seem important here. For example, Quarterly_Report.docx and Document1.docx are different documents.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Looking at the sequence. Starting with Quartery_Report.docx, then switching to Document1.docx. Then after saving Document1, they go to Chrome for email. The email interaction might be part of editing Document1, since they later reference the budget in Document1.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: Alternatively, maybe each case is a specific document or task. For example, Case1: Quarterly_Report.docx Case2: Document1.docx including the email and PDF steps Case3: Budget_2024.xlsx Case4: Report_Draft.pdf

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The case could be defined by the document being the primary focus, and any related actions in other apps are part of that case. For example, when working on Document1.docx, the email and PDF interactions are part of that case because they are related to editing the document.

Name: Backtracking - IND
Text: Hmm, this is tricky. Maybe the case is determined by the active window/document. When the user switches to another app like Chrome, that app's activities belong to the current case of the document they were working on? Alternatively, each time they switch to a new document, that starts a new case.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Looking at each event: 1. FOCUS on Quarterly_Report.docx starts case1 but then switch. 2. FOCUS on Document1.docx starts Case2. All events from 09:00 until closing Document1 are part of Case2 including switches to Chrome, Adobe, Excel. Then FOCUS on Quarterly_Report again starts Case1.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: For activity naming: FOCUS: Open Document TYPING: Type Text SAVE: Save Document SWITCH: Switch Application CLICK: Open Email, Reply Email SCROLL: Scroll Email HIGHLIGHT: Annotate PDF etc. Combine with application context like Type Text Word, Save Document Word.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Compiling into event log table with Case ID Document1_1 for events from FOCUS Document1 to CLOSE, including all switches and related actions. Quarterly_Report_1 for later events. Activities like Open Document Word, Type Text Word, Switch to Chrome, Open Email, Send Email, etc.
